job_title: Community Outreach Coordinator in La Grange, IL
pros: Great culture, the people are really nice and helpful

pros: Leadership opportunities as you grow with the agency
cons: Community mental health is not easy

pros: I enjoyed working with the community
cons: Lots of favoritism, you must be a part of the managerial clique to be considered for promotion.

pros: Consultation groups regularly; supportive staff environment.
cons: Turnover in certain positions; lower salary due to being a nonprofit.

pros: The staff is very nice and lenient when it comes to days off and hours.
cons: I had a good experience here no bad ones.

pros: Good place to begin a career in mental health
cons: The pay is lower with general understaffing in several departments

pros: Decent place to gain experience.
cons: Can’t expect much from a non-profit agency. Training is a joke. Expect to basically train yourself. To be honest, the salary isn’t great. You can make more money with sales or even working for Uber. If you drive to work, expect to be moving your car constantly and expect to receive tickets because you cant park for more than two hours in the same spot. Or other employees/ clients park poorly so they take up double the parking space. you get a lot of clients (1-3 new clients each week). If you don’t meet productivity you’ll get more clients. More clients equal more paperwork, more deadlines. Policies and protocols are always changing so expect little consistency. Supervisors demand a lot from employees and have high expectations. If you don’t feel comfortable doing something, they kinda manipulate you to do it or they’ll say you’re not being a team player. Everyone stays to themselves for the most part and some offices/employees can be hostile. There’s various unnecessary meetings you have to attend per week/month. Clients are demanding and needy if you don’t set boundaries and sometimes you have to take their calls even on your days off. Supervisors can be biased and often favor other employees. Favored employees who don’t follow protocols, get away with it. If you’re not favored, expect to be informed about your wrong doing. This agency is all about money so they will have their employees bill as much as possible. So basically expect to be overworked, underpaid and unhappy.

job_title: Respite Worker Community Support Individual in Western Springs, IL
pros: Foot in the door opportunity
cons: No insurance as it is a casual position

review_title: Clinical services and supervision of clinical staff
pros: Welcoming and driven environment; motivation to provide best services to the people in the communities served and beyond. Leadership team is driven to make systems efficient and promotes personal and professional growth opportunities. Commitment to provide clinical supervision and consultation groups for student interns and staff. Cultural sensitivity and awareness is openly addressed by CEO and members throughout various departments and programs, and across all ageny sites.
cons: Salary is moderate in comparison to for profit work opportunities. At times it is possible one or few dissatisfied staff greatly impact overall staff satisfaction, which is unfortunate for the agency.

pros: I get to work with troubled youth out in the community.  I find that working with clients in their natural environment (home, park, recreational settings, mall, etc.) is very beneficial because they are more comfortable to be themselves and talk about their concerns.  I also love that I get to create my own schedule.
cons:
Sometimes it can be hard to be in touch with the client's therapist, which can be very frustrating when you need to consult about the client's progress or best treatment.  
Another challenge is working with the parents.  Some parents are great and involved, but most of them are dealing with depression or other problems themselves and is hard to get them on board.

job_title: Respite Worker in Western Springs, IL
pros: Experience in the field prior to receiving degree. Part-time position to supplement a stay-at home or to have side money. Work with an individual child or adolescent in the field. Collaborate with other Respite workers, families, and therapist to develop client's goals and provide interventions for treatment plan. Reimbursement for mileage, expenses, and time. opportunity for 1- 3 hours up to 10-20 hours weekly. Able to have multiple client case load. paid bi weekly. Monthly supervision. I select my schedule and work hours.
cons: need to use my own car (but mileage is reimbursed)

job_title: Mental Health Therapist in Berwyn, IL
pros: Not one good thing about this place.
cons: Very low pay, upper management treats you bad, not valued as an employee, more of a sales job they rate you based on how much you bill, terrible work conditions, offices have very old carpet, mold, bugs, mice.

pros: Pillars provides great professional development opportunities, regular supervision, consultation and job support. Impressed by the sense of community and personal growth mindset in staff and leadership.
cons: Community Mental Health agencies in general have lower budgets therefore salaries are not competitive to private hospitals.
